name: Life Simulator
description:
Life Simulator is a simulation game with relaxed atmosphere. Players will play as a college graduate getting into the big city, you will fight for your life for four years, you can be a winner with cars, houses and soul mate, or maybe a salty fish with nothing, and you can also find love...


Introduce: That’s a huge difference between life in school and in society. In this game, you need to work for better life, you need to buy car, house and money to ask girl out... you will face 996 working hour system, family’s pressure, and your account only has less than 100 bucks, will you feel the inability? Did you ever consider solve these troubles? The best solution is to be rich,but do you think the riches are happy? They are happier than what you think. You need to try your best to earn money, otherwise you will be defeated when you cannot afford the rent. If you are lucky enough, you can also buy lottery, or start up you own business, but every investment has its own risks, please be careful.


Open ending: this game has lots of endings, you can choose to live the life you want, it is important to choose, and the process is also important, they will both reflect the ending of this game. But if you do not reach your goal, You can also inherit your family's old house, ride the bus, and become a ordinary but peaceful person.


Game features: we left school and step into the society, no one knows what our future will be, and only we know what kind of person we want to be, maybe the pressure to let you get out of breath, perhaps you into economic distress, but you are growing. You can always choose what your life will be, travel when you want, take a walk when you are tired, do some work when you want to prove yourself...Or be an entrepreneur... car, house, partner, a winner in life.



Scheduling - As a recent graduate, have you experienced any setbacks or frustrations at work? Do you value life more than work?




Promotions and raises - Do you think a raise or promotion is a long way off in the face of all those overworked?




Scenes and Events - Have you ever been warmed by a stranger's help?




Socializing - Pressing thumb up becoming your daily routine when you have so many friends you barely touch?




Relax and travel - do you sometimes want to go on a trip, take a picture of yourself then post a moment?




Dream and Persistence -- Has buying a house and a car become your goal? Will your persistence pay off?
